Buckshot
  • Docs
    • User Guide
    • API

Buckshot

A fast Minecraft name sniper

Get started
./buckshot Developed by @tropicbliss#0408 on Discord THIS SNIPER IS 100% FREE ON GITHUB ⌛ Initialising... ✨ Initialisation complete. Your offset is: 10 ms Sniping Vols in ~113 minutes | sniping at 2021-07-28 13:08:30 (utc) Successfully signed in Setup complete [fail] 429 @ 2021-07-28 13:08:30.003769 [fail] 403 @ 2021-07-28 13:08:30.005697 [success] 200 @ 2021-07-28 13:08:30.153340 Successfully sniped Vols!

Features

  • Mojang account sniping
  • Microsoft account sniping
  • GC sniping
  • Spread (delay between asynchronous sniping requests)
  • Auto offset
  • Change skin on snipe
  • Name queueing
  • Low latency by opening the TCP connections before sending requests
  • High requests/second by bypassing HTTP overhead

Setup

  1. Download the sniper.
  2. Use Dimension 4 on Windows for time synchronisation.
  3. Open up the terminal and navigate to the working directory and run ./buckshot-<platform>-<architecture> (if you're on Windows, do yourself a favor and use Windows Terminal instead of cmd.exe). I assume you use MCsniperPY so this process should be relatively straightforward.
  4. This should generate config.toml on the same directory in which you can edit.
  5. Read the errors. I've spent a large amount of time making the errors easy to read. If you encounter HTTP errors, something might be wrong with the internet or the servers on the other end.

Moar tips for sniping

  • Snipe with a VPS close to api.minecraftservices.com origin server (in N. Virginia) as it will minimise ping fluctuations.
  • Even though this sniper is asynchronous and it is possible to snipe a name with one thread, using a multi-threaded processor can improve performance.

Command line arguments

Run buckshot --help or ./buckshot --help.

Compiling from source

  1. Download the rustup toolchain. Follow the instructions for your platform.
  2. Run git clone https://github.com/tropicbliss/buckshot.git in an appropriate directory to clone the repo.
  3. In the folder named buckshot, run cargo build --release. The resulting executable file after compilation should be in the target/release/ directory, relative from the buckshot folder. If you encounter any errors throughout the compilation process, read through the errors as they generally tell you exactly what to do. Typically, when compiling for Linux, you'll need build-essential.

Bug reporting

Feel free to use the GitHub issues tab. This is a new sniper so there may be tons of bugs.

API

Authentication API

Mojang is moving to Microsoft accounts. Starting December 2020, all new accounts already use the new system, and older accounts will be migrated later. See this blog post for more information.

There are multiple ways to obtain an access token. However, for the purposes of this sniper, methods that use 2FA cannot be used as name queueing would require user intervention. Everything in this sniper has to be automated, so a trade-off is required in which only accounts that has 2FA disabled can be used by this API (and thus this sniper).

This API allows a developer to pass in a user's email and password and receive a bearer token for interacting with Mojang's various APIs.

This endpoint has a rate-limit of 3 requests per minute.

Request

  • Method: POST

  • Endpoint: /api/auth

  • Full URL: buckshot.tropicbliss.net/api/auth

  • Headers:

    • Accept: application/json

As the POST body, simply supply your desired username.

{
    "email": "simple@example.com",
    "password": "youaremylittlepogchamp"
}

Response

200: OK

Successfully authenticated user! Here is a sample response:

{
    "bearer_token": "foobar"
}
400: Bad Request

Something went wrong while authenticating the user. The value of the error key in the JSON might tell you more about what went wrong. Feel free to deserialise the JSON to present the error directly to the user as an error message.

{
    "error": "Incorrect email or password"
}
429: Too Many Requests

You have exceeded the endpoint's rate-limit. Wait 20 seconds then try again.
